ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Definitely expanded my theater/playwriting vocabulary and comfort zone. Most of the plays on the syllabus were ones I hadn't read in other courses before, and were helpful in my development as a playwright.
I developed stronger playwriting skills, and got a good insight into different conceits and ways to structure a play, depending on what I want to talk about.
Great plays and the tools to write a great play
I learned a lot about playwriting and what it means to craft a good play. We also got to read tons of plays from a bunch of different time periods, which was really awesome too!
Vocabulary for discussing craft, greater familiarity with American theater.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It's definitely a marathon class. Writing a whole script on top of weekly reading/writing assignments is a commitment and can be overwhelming. Sometimes there were too many scripts per week, like we only really had time to discuss one or two, otherwise it got really jumbled/several hours of discussion is just too much so the days that we got to do some discussion, read some exercises, critique some drafts, those were better.
I wish we had more time to share each other's writing aloud. That was one of my favorite parts of the course, but I understand that it was hard to fit everything in.
Margulies makes himself so available, and you really learn a lot by the weekly exercises, writing your own one act play, and hearing others' writing
Prof. Margulies is very invested in his students and their plays! One weakness of the course is that we received no feedback throughout the semester on many of our assignments...

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely, if you are interested in playwriting and/or directing/theater studies.

Yes. The plays you read are moving, the weekly exercises make you grow as a writer, and you write a full one act play by the end. Margulies is also excellent  he really cares about his students, he makes himself readily available, and his feedback is excellent.
yes! If you're really serious about writing and playwriting, take this course-- otherwise,  I wouldn't.
If you want to write a playyes.
